isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, SYSTEM DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE (WITH R-12 REFRIGERANT SYSTEM) - SPECIAL SERVICE TOOLS - HIGH VACUUM PUMP

svcproc.title: HIGH VACUUM PUMP
svcproc.para: The OEM-1315 high vacuum pump features a lightweight aluminum housing ( Figure 25). The 4.5-CFM, offset rotary vane provides powerful, quiet, high vacuum capability. Pump capacity speeds "pull down" time and assure moisture removal.

Gas ballast helps eliminate moisture contaminations by allowing metered amounts of atmospheric air to enter the pump at the compression phase of the exhaust cycle. This reduces moisture from contaminating the vacuum pump oil.

It is recommended that a vacuum pump be dedicated to each type of refrigerant system. If the PAG oil used in HFC-134A systems is pulled into the vacuum pump and mixes with the mineral-based oil used in the pump, the vacuum pump may fail.
